item.title: The victor and the defeated - 60 years later
item.description: Taiwan News The victor and the defeated: 60 years later by James Wang On the eve of the end of the Second World War, one recently released report come to my mind.

item.title: U.S. Should Help Taiwan On the Diplomatic Front
item.description: Taipei Times U.S. Should Help Taiwan On the Diplomatic Front by James Wang Although the U.S. government continues to complain about the lack of transparency in China’s military modernizaton, it is crystal clear that China’s militray build-up poses a seriuos threat to the security of Taiwan and, in the long terms, the U.

item.title: Henry Kissinger Forgets What He said
item.description: Taipei Times Henry Kissinger Forgets What He said by James Wang Dr. Henry A. Kissinger, former U.S. secretary of state, is a man known for his craftiness in the nuance of diplomatic language.

item.title: Peng Ming-min Case as seen in American Diplomatic Files
item.description: Taiwan News Peng Ming-min Case as seen in American Diplomatic Files by James Wang Forty years ago, Gimo Chiang Kai-shek was still enthusiastically shouting slogans of counter-attack and regaining control over Chinese mainland.

item.title: The Triangular Relations Become History
item.description: Taipei Times The Triangular Relations Become History By James Wang Without a fanafre,the United States and Russia reached a three-page long nuclear arms reduction treaty, and Russia becomes a partner of NATO, indicating its further integration with the West.

item.title: San Francisco Peace Treaty Revisited
item.description: For Taipei Times San Francisco Peace Treaty Revisited by James Wang When former president Lee Teng-hui embraced the idea that “sovereignty resides in the people,” his statement didn’t raise many eyebrows.

item.title: Mr. Lien's Political Judgment In Question
item.description: For Taipei Times Mr. Lien’s Political Judgment In Question by James Wang At a time when the Middle east was in crisis, the Bush Administration was under fire for its inaction in seeking for peace, and the situation in the Taiwan Strait was relatively quiet, it is hard to explain why Mr.
